    • Method Detail

      • getResponsibleValueAt

        public Any getResponsibleValueAt(int row,
                                 int column)
        Return the responsible value, as opposed to the rendered value, for the given row and column. The responsible value is only different from the rendered value if a specific responsible value has been established in the RenderInfo

      • setContext

        public void setContext(Any context)
        Provide the node from which the table root will be evaluated

      • getLevels

      • getRenderInfo

        public RenderInfo getRenderInfo(int c)
        Returns the RenderInfo object that is rendering the specified column. The column number is specified in the model's column index. If the view reorders the columns it must convert the view index to the model index.

      • setVisibleRows

        public void setVisibleRows(int visibleRows)
        Allows the table model to specify a number of visible rows hint.

      • getVisibleRows

        public int getVisibleRows()

      • getRealRowCount

        public int getRealRowCount()
        Returns the real number of rows in the model. This may not be the same as the value given by super.getRowCount() as the model is at liberty to return the number of visible rows when the root data node cannot be resolved.

        For a tree table, the real row count depends on the expansion state of the tree.

      • isTreeTable

        public boolean isTreeTable()
        Description copied from interface: TableModel
        Whether this model supports a tree-table or just a table. In general, a model implementation will be either a tree table or a flat table, but not both.

      • getTreeModel

        public TreeModel getTreeModel()
        Description copied from interface: TableModel
        Return the underlying tree model. Optional operation, supported only if the implementation is a tree table

      • newSelection

        public Map newSelection(ListSelectionModel lm,
                        Map selection,
                        Array keySelection,
                        Array indexSelection,
                        IntI selectCount)
        Leave objects representing the current selection, keySelection and the count of selected items in the supplied variables according to the state of the given ListSelectionModel.

        In the case of a tree table, the

      • setItemSelection

        public void setItemSelection(ListSelectionModel l,
                             Array selection,
                             Map newSelection)
        Establish the necessary selection intervals to select the given items in the list model.

        For a TreeTable the number of rows varies with the expansion state of the tree. Nodes that are not currently displayed will not be selected.

        Parameters:
        l - the ListSelectionModel that will be modified.
        selection - the names (map keys) of the row root nodes to be selected.
        newSelection - the result of the map keys of the row root nodes to the nodes themselves.

      • setIndexSelection

        public void setIndexSelection(ListSelectionModel l,
                              Array selection,
                              Map newSelection)

      • setModelRoot

        public void setModelRoot(Any newRoot,
                         JTable t)
                  throws AnyException
        Tell this model where to find the root of its data. This will remove any editor if the table is editing.

        This is an undefined operation for a TreeTable and setLevels must be used to establish the model.

        Throws:
        AnyException

      • getModelRoot

        public Any getModelRoot()

        public boolean sort(int[] orderItems,
                    boolean isDescending,
                    JTree tree)
             throws AnyException
        Sort the model according to the supplied items, which is a list of column numbers in model coordinates, in the specified order.
        Throws:
        AnyException

      • getCellEditor

        public TableCellEditor getCellEditor(int row,
                                     int column)
        Description copied from interface: TableModel
        Return the cell editor suitable for editing the cell at the specified row and column. If a row of -1 is specified then the implementation may throw an exception or create an editor for the column as a whole, as appropriate.

      • setCellEditor

        public void setCellEditor(TableCellEditor tce,
                          int row,
                          int column)
        Description copied from interface: TableModel
        Set the cell editor for the specified row and column. The implementation may be mode limited than to support editors on a cell by cell basis.
        row - the row for which the editor is being specified. If row == -1 then the row is not being specified.
        column - the column for which the editor is being specified.

      • getCellRenderer

        public TableCellRenderer getCellRenderer(int row,
                                         int column)
        Fetches the renderer for the specfied row and column. If the row is < 0 then no node is determined and the renderer is that configured at the table level. Otherwise the node for the specified row may specify a particular renderer.
        Returns:
        the cell renderer

      • translateEvent

        public boolean translateEvent(Event e,
                              JTable table,
                              JTree tree)
                       throws AnyException
        Convert the received node event into a JTable event. Only events that relate to the given table will be dispatched to the model. This method may cancel any edit in progress, if the event affects the editing cell.
        Throws:
        AnyException

      • getEventPaths

        public Map getEventPaths()
        Return a mapping of object paths to leaf node fields that should be dispatched to views of this model.

      • getRowAt

        public Any getRowAt(int row)
        Returns the row-root node for the specified row. In the tree table case there is a node set at each level. Depending on which level the row refers to, the node returned will be a child of the node set at the tree path represented by the selected node.

      • getRowKey

        public Any getRowKey(int row)
        Returns the key (that is the name) of the specified row. See also getRowAt

      • getTreeRenderer

        public JTree getTreeRenderer()
        Provide access to the JTree renderer

      • getTreeLevel

        public TreeLevel getTreeLevel(int row)
        Description copied from interface: TableModel
        Return the TreeLevel relevant to the given row. TODO: Expansions
        Returns:
        The TreeLevel
